eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.


Example uses:
- Floating objects, such as powerups or coins
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SineMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave, or an ellipsis.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Allow an object to move smoothly on the X and/or Y axis following a sine wave.

Example uses:
- Floating pickups
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Horizontal distance

Tips:
- For circular or elliptical movement, the horizontal and vertical speed need to be the same
- For horizontal movement, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement, set horizontal distance to 0
- For figure-8 movement, set horizontal speed to 1/2 of the vertical speed.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
* __Paint effect:__Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
effect type:
  * __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
  * __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
  * __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
  * __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Disable effect when the game starts.
Avoid default parameter of painter that could make the extension doesn't work.

Initialise position of painter. 
Increment or decrement "_TimeProgressionEffect" depending on direction.

Here this the paints functions of different effect depending on the type chosen by the user.
Detect the direction of the animation and its end.
Type 2 : screen come from top then return.
Type 3 : screen come from left then return.
Type 4 : a circle scale up from the middle then scale down.
The repeat 5 times is used to have clean and smooth edges , especially for circle.

eventsFunctions.description: Paint Effect.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffect
eventsFunctions.sentence: Paint effect type _PARAM4_ of _PARAM0_ with direction _PARAM5_ and color _PARAM2_ for _PARAM3_ seconds

events.comment:
Initialise all variables and then activate the behavior.
If user doesn't assign value to color and type , we take the last value registred.
If user doesn't assign value to timer we take a default value (0.2).

eventsFunctions.description: Paint effect ended.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffectIsEnd

events.comment: Detect when the animation ends with a timer which is initialised in PaintEffect function.

propertyDescriptors.label: The maximum of the opacity only for flash
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxOpacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Change camera zoom using actions or allow users to change zoom by scrolling the mouse wheel or pressing keys.
An anchor point can be defined to keep what is under the cursor at the same place on screen.

### Actions

- Change camera zoom with mouse wheel
- Change camera zoom by pressing keys
- Zoom at a given speed
- Change the zoom with an anchor point
- Zoom at a given speed and with an anchor point
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraZoom
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change camera zoom using several methods including user input.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second).
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change camera zoom at speed: _PARAM1_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Change camera zoom (instantly) and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change camera zoom and use an anchor point
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set camera zoom to: _PARAM1_ with anchor at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

events.comment:
When zooming the vector in pixels from the center to the anchor must stay the same.
It gives this system:

/ pixel_delta(t-1) = (anchor - center(t-1)) * zoom(t-1)
| pixel_delta(t) = (anchor - center(t)) * zoom(t)
\ pixel_delta(t) = pixel_delta(t-1)

where the new center can be resolved to:

center(t) = anchor + (center(t-1) - anchor) * zoom(t-1) / zoom(t)

parameters:
GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorX")
+ (
   CameraX(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
   - GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorX")
)
* CameraZoom(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
/ GetArgumentAsNumber("Zoom")

GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorY")
+ (
   CameraY(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
   - GetArgumentAsNumber("AnchorY")
)
* CameraZoom(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"), GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera"))
/ GetArgumentAsNumber("Zoom")

parameters.longDescription: 1: Initial zoom, 2: zoom in x2, 0.5: zoom out x2...
parameters.name: Zoom

eventsFunctions.description: Change the camera zoom at a given speed (in factor per second) and keep an anchor point fixed on screen (instead of the center).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Zoom camera over time and use an anchor point
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithSpeedAndAnchor
eventsFunctions.sentence: Zoom camera at speed: _PARAM1_ and anchor at: _PARAM4_; _PARAM5_ (layer: _PARAM2_, camera: _PARAM3_)

parameters.longDescription: Zoom by a factor per second. 1: no effect, 2: zoom in x2 every second, 0.5: zoom out x2 every second.
parameters.name: ZoomSpeed

eventsFunctions.description: Change camera zoom with mouse wheel.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change camera zoom with mouse wheel
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithMouseWheel
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change camera zoom with mouse wheel (Layer: _PARAM1_, Zoom speed: _PARAM3_, Min zoom: _PARAM5_, Max zoom: _PARAM6_, Zoom towards cursor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Don't enforce zoom range when MaxZoom is left empty (MaxZoom=0)

eventsFunctions.description: Change camera zoom by pressing keys.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Change camera zoom by pressing keys
eventsFunctions.name: ZoomWithKeypress
eventsFunctions.sentence: Press _PARAM6_ to zoom in and _PARAM7_ to zoom out (Layer: _PARAM1_, Zoom speed: _PARAM3_, Min zoom: _PARAM4_, Max zoom: _PARAM5_)

events.comment: Don't enforce zoom range when MaxZoom is left empty (MaxZoom=0)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object 
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object 
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)

Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides values based on picked object instances.  
Useful for camera tracking, flocking behaviors, and more.

Included expressions

Center points:
- X center point (absolute) 
- Y center point (absolute)
- X center point (average) 
- Y center point (average)

Based on AABB of objects:
- Minimum X position
- Minimum Y position
- Maximum X position
- Maximum Y position

Force expressions:
- Average horizontal force (X)
- Average vertical force (Y)

Angle expressions:
- Average angle of rotation

Size expressions:
- Average width
- Average height

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: add_, @Jurfix
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Expressions:
 - Mathematical constants
 - Greatest common factor/Lowest common multiple
 - Factorial
 - Coordinates conversion for polar and isometric systems
 - ToFixedString: Formats a number into a string with the specified number of decimal places
 - ToFixed: (Deprecated) Formats a number to use the specified number of decimal places

Conditions:
- IsEven: Check if the number is even (divisible by 2)

Release Notes:

Version 1.0.7
- Added ToFixedString()
- Deprecated ToFixed() because it does not show any trailing zeros for whole numbers. Prefer using ToFixedString() to set values in text objects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Parallax
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behaviors to animate Tiled Sprite objects in the background, following the camera with a parallax effect.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the image of a Tiled Sprite to follow the camera horizontally with a parallax effect. After adding this to an object, put the object on a layer that is not moving, behind the layer that is followed (for example, a layer called "Background").
eventsBasedBehaviors.fullName: Horizontal Parallax for a Tiled Sprite
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: HorizontalTiledSpriteParallax

propertyDescriptors.label: Parallax factor (speed for the parallax, usually between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: ParallaxFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer to be followed (leave empty for the base layer)
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowedLayer

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move the image of a Tiled Sprite to follow the camera vertically with a parallax effect. After adding this to an object, put the object on a layer that is not moving, behind the layer that is followed (for example, a layer called "Background").

eventsBasedBehaviors.name: VerticalTiledSpriteParallax

propertyDescriptors.label: Parallax factor (speed for the parallax, usually between 0 and 1)
propertyDescriptors.name: ParallaxFactor

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer to be followed (leave empty for the base layer)
propertyDescriptors.name: FollowedLayer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Useful when multiple layers need to use the same camera values.

How to use:
- Run the "Copy camera settings" action after all other camera actions have been performed

Tips:
- Do not use on layers that implement a parallax effect
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CopyCameraSettings
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Copy the camera settings of a layer and apply them to another layer.

eventsFunctions.description: Copy camera settings of a layer and apply them to another layer.
eventsFunctions.name: CopyCameraSettings
eventsFunctions.sentence: Copy camera settings of _PARAM1_ layer and apply them to _PARAM3_ layer (X position: _PARAM5_, Y position: _PARAM6_, Zoom: _PARAM7_,  Angle: _PARAM8_)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Move camera to the room that contains the trigger object (usually the player).  If desired, change zoom to show the entire room or keep zoom static.

How to use:
- Place room objects on scene
- Select camera zoom limits, how fast the camera should move, and the visible buffer around each room
- Run the "Move and zoom camera" action on every frame
- Move the trigger object (player) between rooms and the camera will center on the room that contains the trigger object.

Tips:
- Use these conditions for custom logic when changing rooms : "Camera moving", "Camera zooming", and "Room changed"
- Set "Lerp Speed" to "1" to change the camera instantly
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RoomBasedCameraMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move and zoom camera to the room object that contains the trigger object (usually the player).

eventsFunctions.description: Move and zoom camera to the room object that contains the trigger object (usually the player).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Move and zoom camera to the room object that contains the trigger object (player)
eventsFunctions.name: MoveCameraToActiveRoom
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move camera to room object _PARAM1_ that contains trigger object _PARAM2_ (Layer: _PARAM3_, Lerp speed: _PARAM4_, Max zoom: _PARAM5_, Min zoom: _PARAM6_, Border buffer: _PARAM7_px)

events.comment: Set default values if none provided
Detect which room is the current one
Assign each room a unique ID if they don't have one yet
Check if this room is the current room
Adjust zoom to stay within min/max values
For rooms smaller than the viewable screen, center the camera on the center of the room
For rooms larger than the viewable screen, center the camera on the TriggerObject and clamp camera so it only shows the room + buffer

parameters:
ceil(lerp(CameraX(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"),GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera")), clamp(TriggerObject.CenterX(), 
RoomObject.CenterX() - RoomObject.Width()/2 + SceneWindowWidth()/2 - GetArgumentAsNumber("OutsideBuffer"), RoomObject.CenterX() + RoomObject.Width()/2 - SceneWindowWidth()/2 + GetArgumentAsNumber("OutsideBuffer")), Variable(__RoomBasedCameraMovement.LerpSpeed))*100)/100

ceil(lerp(CameraY(GetArgumentAsString("Layer"),GetArgumentAsNumber("Camera")), clamp(TriggerObject.CenterY(), 
RoomObject.CenterY() - RoomObject.Height()/2 + SceneWindowHeight()/2 - GetArgumentAsNumber("OutsideBuffer"), RoomObject.CenterY() + RoomObject.Height()/2 - SceneWindowHeight()/2 + GetArgumentAsNumber("OutsideBuffer")), Variable(__RoomBasedCameraMovement.LerpSpeed))*100)/100

parameters.longDescription: Room objects are used to mark areas that should be seen by the camera.
parameters.name: RoomObject

parameters.longDescription: When the Trigger Object touches a new Room Object, the camera will move to the new room
parameters.name: TriggerObject

parameters.longDescription: Minimum extra space displayed around each side the room
parameters.name: OutsideBuffer

eventsFunctions.name: ActiveRoomChanged
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM1_ has just entered a new room

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera is zooming (requires the use of "Move and zoom camera" action in this extension).
eventsFunctions.name: IsCameraZooming

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera is moving (requires the use of "Move and zoom camera" action in this extension).
eventsFunctions.name: IsCameraMoving

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Enables users to click and drag on objects to move them.  The object will retain velocity when the click is released, which can allow users to fling objects across the screen.

Note:
- The standard "draggable" behavior will not work on objects that have the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggablePhysics

events.comment: Create mouse joints and save the joint ID
Update the position of the mouse joint to follow the mouse

eventsFunctions.description: Release dragged object.
eventsFunctions.name: ReleaseDrag

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object is being dragged.
eventsFunctions.name: IsBeingDragged

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.

There are also actions to bounce at a *specific angle* - useful when you know the obstacle must generate a bounce that is always in a specific direction.

>  This *won't work* with Physics engine or Platformer characters. This is working with objects that are moved using actions or behaviors using **the forces**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Bounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Bounce

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff

events.comment:
To bounce the object realistically, we first separate it from the obstacle. The collision engine will do it by moving the object through the shortest "normal vector" of the edge that was collided.
We store the position of the object before being moved so that we know the angle of this "normal vector". Once we know it, we add a force in the direction of the normal vector, and we add the difference between the normal vector and the previous angle of movement.

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be calculated *to go toward the specified angle (the "normal angle")*. For example, if the object is arriving at this exact angle, it will bounce in the opposite direction.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Bounce off another object toward a specified angle
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffSpecificAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Bounce _PARAM0_ off _PARAM2_ assuming a normal angle of _PARAM3_

events.comment:
Check if there is a collision between the object and an obstacle and if so, do the bounce by stopping the object and adding a force so that it goes in the "reflected" direction, using the "normal" angle provided. 
This provides a realistic bounce.

parameters.description: The "normal" angle, in degrees, to bounce against
parameters.longDescription: This can be understood at the direction that the bounce must go toward.
parameters.name: NormalAngle

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be vertical, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly horizontal obstacle* (like the top/bottom of the screen in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 90 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: -90 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffVertically

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be horizontal, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly vertical obstacle* (like paddles in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 0 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: 180 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffHorizontally
